clusters.title: Afghanistan earthquake live: more than 600 dead after shallow quake strikes country’s east, state media reports

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake live: more than 600 dead after shallow quake strikes country’s east, state media reports
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says ministry for public health, as rescue operations take placeAt least 250 dead after 6.0 magnitude quake near JalalabadRescuers are operating across Afghanistan’s east, with helicopters helping bring the injured to safety, while rubble is combed through in the hunt for survivors.The Taliban interior ministry has said in a statement that the vast majority of deaths occurred in the Kunar region (610), with a further 12 deaths in Nangarhar.The UN in Afghanistan is deeply saddened by the devastating earthquake that struck the eastern region & claimed hundreds of lives, injuring many more.Our teams are on the ground, delivering emergency assistance & lifesaving support. Our thoughts are with the affected communities. Continue reading...
items.content: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says ministry for public health, as rescue operations take placeAt least 250 dead after 6.0 magnitude quake near JalalabadRescuers are operating across Afghanistan’s east, with helicopters helping bring the injured to safety, while rubble is combed through in the hunt for survivors.The Taliban interior ministry has said in a statement that the vast majority of deaths occurred in the Kunar region (610), with a further 12 deaths in Nangarhar.The UN in Afghanistan is deeply saddened by the devastating earthquake that struck the eastern region & claimed hundreds of lives, injuring many more.Our teams are on the ground, delivering emergency assistance & lifesaving support. Our thoughts are with the affected communities. Continue reading...

items.content: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake centred near the bustling eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad late Sunday caused extensive damage and killed hundreds of people. The Taliban-led interior ministry said in a statement that 622 people had been killed and 1,500 injured.

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake: at least 250 dead after 6.0 magnitude quake near Jalalabad
items.standfirst: Province of Kunar sees large number of casualties, according to local officials, amid fears of much higher toll after shallow quake hits near Pakistan borderAfghanistan earthquake – latest updatesAt least 250 people were dead and hundreds more injured in a magnitude 6 earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border, authorities have said, as rescuers combed the rubble of homes looking for survivors.The quake struck the rugged province of Kunar at 11.47pm on Sunday and was centred 27km north-east of the city of Jalalabad in Nangarhar province, the US Geological Survey said. It was just 8km deep. Shallower quakes tend to cause more damage. Continue reading...
items.content: Province of Kunar sees large number of casualties, according to local officials, amid fears of much higher toll after shallow quake hits near Pakistan borderAfghanistan earthquake – latest updatesAt least 250 people were dead and hundreds more injured in a magnitude 6 earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan near the Pakistan border, authorities have said, as rescuers combed the rubble of homes looking for survivors.The quake struck the rugged province of Kunar at 11.47pm on Sunday and was centred 27km north-east of the city of Jalalabad in Nangarhar province, the US Geological Survey said. It was just 8km deep. Shallower quakes tend to cause more damage. Continue reading...

items.title: More than 600 killed and 1,500 injured after earthquake hits Afghanistan
items.standfirst: At least 622 people have been killed and more than 1,500 injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan, a spokesperson for the country's Taliban-run interior ministry has said.
items.content: At least 622 people have been killed and more than 1,500 injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan, a spokesperson for the country's Taliban-run interior ministry has said.

ai_summary: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, causing widespread destruction and casualties.
The quake hit near Jalalabad in Kunar province, causing significant damage to several villages.
Over 600 deaths have been reported, with many more injured, according to initial reports.
Rescue operations are underway, with helicopters assisting in transporting the injured.
The UN is providing emergency assistance and support to the affected communities.

clusters.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
clusters.neutral_headline: Xi Jinping Criticizes Bullying, Putin Blames West at Summit

items.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
items.standfirst: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...
items.content: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...

items.title: Xi slams 'bullying', Putin defends Ukraine invasion at China’s SCO summit
items.standfirst: Opening the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin on Monday, Chinese President Xi Jinping blasted the "bullying behaviour" of certain countries in a veiled reference to US President Donald Trump's tariff war. In his speech to the gathering of Eurasian leaders, Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed the West for triggering the Ukraine war.
items.content: Opening the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin on Monday, Chinese President Xi Jinping blasted the "bullying behaviour" of certain countries in a veiled reference to US President Donald Trump's tariff war. In his speech to the gathering of Eurasian leaders, Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed the West for triggering the Ukraine war.

items.title: Putin, Modi and Erdoğan among leaders in China for talks with Xi
items.standfirst: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...
items.content: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...

items.title: Vladimir Putin meets Xi Jinping arrives in China for security summit – Ukraine war live
items.standfirst: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...

items.title: China and India discuss disputed border at key summit - as Putin talks about Trump

items.content: At a time when Donald Trump's foreign policy continues to frustrate some and perplex others, Vladimir Putin, Xi Jinping and Narendra Modi have gathered to discuss trade and international security.

items.title: Sco Summit: Xi aims at showing global south unity, with Modi and Putin
items.standfirst: China’s Xi Jinping welcomed on Sunday Russia’s Vladimir Putin, India’s Narendra Modi and leaders from around 20 countries to the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, a high-security gathering aimed at boosting Beijing’s influence and promoting "a multipolar world order". Shirli Sitbon has more.
items.content: China’s Xi Jinping welcomed on Sunday Russia’s Vladimir Putin, India’s Narendra Modi and leaders from around 20 countries to the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, a high-security gathering aimed at boosting Beijing’s influence and promoting "a multipolar world order". Shirli Sitbon has more.

items.title: SCO Summit: Putin, Modi join Xi in Tianjin amid Trump tariff war
items.standfirst: China’s Xi Jinping welcomed on Sunday Russia’s Vladimir Putin, India’s Narendra Modi and leaders from around 20 countries to the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, a high-security gathering aimed at boosting Beijing’s influence and promoting "a multipolar world order". France24 correspondent Jan Camenzind Broomby reports from Tapei, Taiwan.
items.content: China’s Xi Jinping welcomed on Sunday Russia’s Vladimir Putin, India’s Narendra Modi and leaders from around 20 countries to the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Tianjin, a high-security gathering aimed at boosting Beijing’s influence and promoting "a multipolar world order". France24 correspondent Jan Camenzind Broomby reports from Tapei, Taiwan.

items.title: Putin, Modi and other world leaders in China for summit

items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.

ai_summary: The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) is underway in China, with leaders in attendance.
Xi Jinping criticized "bullying behavior" while Putin blamed the West for the Ukraine war.
The summit aims to challenge Western-led multilateral blocs.
Leaders from Eurasian member states and other countries are participating.
Modi and Putin met briefly before the summit.

clusters.title: Suspect arrested in fatal shooting of Ukrainian politician, Zelensky says
clusters.neutral_headline: Suspect Arrested in Killing of Ukrainian Politician

items.title: Suspect arrested in fatal shooting of Ukrainian politician, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian officials have arrested a suspect in the shooting death of former parliamentary speaker and prominent Maidan protest leader Andriy Parubiy, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced early Monday. No details of the suspect's identity or motives were revealed, but Zelensky said the arrested man had given an initial statement to investigators.
items.content: Ukrainian officials have arrested a suspect in the shooting death of former parliamentary speaker and prominent Maidan protest leader Andriy Parubiy, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced early Monday. No details of the suspect's identity or motives were revealed, but Zelensky said the arrested man had given an initial statement to investigators.

items.title: Suspect arrested in killing of Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy, Zelenskyy says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Sunday that the suspect in the shooting death of former parliament speaker Andriy Parubiy​ had made "initial statements."
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Sunday that the suspect in the shooting death of former parliament speaker Andriy Parubiy​ had made "initial statements."

items.title: Arrest after fatal shooting of Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says "urgent investigations" are underway to establish what happened.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says "urgent investigations" are underway to establish what happened.

items.title: Investigation launched into ‘horrific murder’ of Ukrainian politician in Lviv
items.standfirst: Former parliamentary speaker Andriy Parubiy shot dead as EU ministers meet to discuss measures to force Moscow to the negotiating tableA Ukrainian former parliamentary speaker was shot dead in Lviv on Saturday, authorities said, as European foreign ministers met to discuss increasing pressure on Moscow to end its war against Ukraine.Andriy Parubiy, a member of parliament who served as parliamentary speaker from 2016 to 2019 and a key figure in Ukraine’s 2013 pro-European Maidan revolution, was shot dead, prosecutors said. A murder investigation has been launched and the president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, condemned the killing as a “horrific murder”. Continue reading...
items.content: Former parliamentary speaker Andriy Parubiy shot dead as EU ministers meet to discuss measures to force Moscow to the negotiating tableA Ukrainian former parliamentary speaker was shot dead in Lviv on Saturday, authorities said, as European foreign ministers met to discuss increasing pressure on Moscow to end its war against Ukraine.Andriy Parubiy, a member of parliament who served as parliamentary speaker from 2016 to 2019 and a key figure in Ukraine’s 2013 pro-European Maidan revolution, was shot dead, prosecutors said. A murder investigation has been launched and the president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, condemned the killing as a “horrific murder”. Continue reading...

items.title: Prominent Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy shot dead in Lviv
items.standfirst: President Zelensky said the killing of Parubiy was a "terrible murder" - with a manhunt under way.
items.content: President Zelensky said the killing of Parubiy was a "terrible murder" - with a manhunt under way.

ai_summary: A suspect has been arrested in the shooting death of Ukrainian politician Andriy Parubiy.
President Zelenskyy announced the arrest, stating the suspect gave an initial statement.
The killing occurred in Lviv, where European ministers met to discuss Ukraine.
Parubiy was a former parliamentary speaker and a key figure in the Maidan revolution.
Investigations are underway to determine the circumstances of the murder.

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized after car crash in New Hampshire
items.standfirst: According to his spokesperson, Giuliani suffered "fractured thoracic vertebrae, multiple lacerations and contusions, as well as injuries to his left arm and lower leg."
items.content: According to his spokesperson, Giuliani suffered "fractured thoracic vertebrae, multiple lacerations and contusions, as well as injuries to his left arm and lower leg."

items.content: The former Trump adviser's car was struck from behind on a highway in New Hampshire, a statement said.

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized after car accident in New Hampshire
items.standfirst: New York City’s ex-mayor, 81, in ‘good spirits’ after being treated for fractured thoracic vertebrae, cuts and bruisesNew York City’s former mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized after getting injured in a car wreck in New Hampshire over the weekend.On Sunday, Giuliani’s head of security, Michael Ragusa, released a statement, saying that the 81-year old was involved in a motor vehicle accident on Saturday evening. According to Ragusa, prior to the incident, Giuliani was flagged down by a woman who was the victim of a domestic violence incident. Continue reading...
items.content: New York City’s ex-mayor, 81, in ‘good spirits’ after being treated for fractured thoracic vertebrae, cuts and bruisesNew York City’s former mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized after getting injured in a car wreck in New Hampshire over the weekend.On Sunday, Giuliani’s head of security, Michael Ragusa, released a statement, saying that the 81-year old was involved in a motor vehicle accident on Saturday evening. According to Ragusa, prior to the incident, Giuliani was flagged down by a woman who was the victim of a domestic violence incident. Continue reading...

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized with broken vertebra after car accident, spokesperson says
items.standfirst: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized with a broken vertebra after a car accident in New Hampshire, according to his spokesperson.
items.content: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized with a broken vertebra after a car accident in New Hampshire, according to his spokesperson. (Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)

ai_summary: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani was hospitalized after a car accident.
The accident occurred in New Hampshire, and Giuliani suffered injuries.
He has a fractured thoracic vertebra, cuts, bruises, and injuries to his arm and leg.
Giuliani's head of security released a statement about the incident.
The accident occurred after Giuliani was flagged down by a woman.

clusters.title: Houthis detain at least 11 UN workers in raids on two agencies in Sana’a
clusters.neutral_headline: Houthis Detain UN Workers in Yemen

items.title: Houthis detain at least 11 UN workers in raids on two agencies in Sana’a
items.standfirst: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...
items.content: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...

items.title: Houthi rebels detain at least 11 UN personnel, envoy to Yemen says
items.standfirst: The United Nations envoy to Yemen, Hans Grundberg, condemned the “arbitrary detentions” of at least 11 UN staff by Houthi rebels on Sunday and demanded that they be “immediately and unconditionally” released. Those arrested included seven World Food Programme employees and three UNICEF workers, a security source in Sanaa told AFP.
items.content: The United Nations envoy to Yemen, Hans Grundberg, condemned the “arbitrary detentions” of at least 11 UN staff by Houthi rebels on Sunday and demanded that they be “immediately and unconditionally” released. Those arrested included seven World Food Programme employees and three UNICEF workers, a security source in Sanaa told AFP.

items.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels raid UN premises and detain several people
items.standfirst: Yemen's Houthi rebels have raided United Nations offices and detained several people, officials have said.
items.content: Yemen's Houthi rebels have raided United Nations offices and detained several people, officials have said.

items.title: Iran-backed Houthis raid UN food and children's agencies in Yemen, detain employee
items.standfirst: The Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations' food and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining at least one U.N. employee, officials said.
items.content: The Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations' food and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining at least one U.N. employee, officials said.(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman/AP)

ai_summary: Houthi rebels detained at least 11 UN personnel in raids in Sana'a.
The raids targeted offices of the UN's food and children's agencies.
The UN envoy to Yemen condemned the "arbitrary detentions."
Those detained included World Food Programme and UNICEF employees.
The Houthis tightened security after an Israeli strike.

items.title: Israeli airstrikes and gunfire have killed 30 around Gaza City, local officials say
items.standfirst: Toll includes 13 people trying to get food near distribution point, as Israeli cabinet to discuss next stages of offensive Israeli airstrikes and gunfire killed at least 30 people in and around Gaza City, local health authorities said, as a 20-boat humanitarian aid flotilla carrying activists including Greta Thunberg set sail from Barcelona for the stricken territory.Authorities said the toll from Israeli tank and gunfire included 13 people who died trying to get food near a distribution site in the Gaza Strip, two in a house in Gaza City and 15, including five children, in a strike on a residential building on Saturday.With Reuters and Agence France-Presse Continue reading...
items.content: Toll includes 13 people trying to get food near distribution point, as Israeli cabinet to discuss next stages of offensive Israeli airstrikes and gunfire killed at least 30 people in and around Gaza City, local health authorities said, as a 20-boat humanitarian aid flotilla carrying activists including Greta Thunberg set sail from Barcelona for the stricken territory.Authorities said the toll from Israeli tank and gunfire included 13 people who died trying to get food near a distribution site in the Gaza Strip, two in a house in Gaza City and 15, including five children, in a strike on a residential building on Saturday.With Reuters and Agence France-Presse Continue reading...

items.title: GPS pay-as-you-go rail tickets to be trialled in England for first time
items.standfirst: East Midlands passengers to check in for travel on their phones and will be automatically charged the best fares at the end of dayA new pay-as-you-go rail ticketing system that tracks passengers’ locations as they travel is to be trialled in England for the first time, as part of the government’s plan to reform the railway network’s complex fare system.Passengers on routes in the East Midlands will be the first in the country to test a pilot system, checking in for travel on their phones with their journey tracked using satellite location technology. Continue reading...

items.title: English councils pay private landlords millions in incentives to house homeless families
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Data gathered by Generation Rent shows 37 councils spent £31m in 2024-25 in one-off payments to individual landlordsCouncils across England are increasingly spending millions of pounds a year in incentive payments to private landlords to persuade them to house homeless families, with campaigners describing it as a “senseless waste of public money”.Data gathered by the campaign group Generation Rent via freedom of information requests showed that 37 councils spent more than £31m on one-off cash payments to private landlords on 10,792 occasions in 2024-25. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Data gathered by Generation Rent shows 37 councils spent £31m in 2024-25 in one-off payments to individual landlordsCouncils across England are increasingly spending millions of pounds a year in incentive payments to private landlords to persuade them to house homeless families, with campaigners describing it as a “senseless waste of public money”.Data gathered by the campaign group Generation Rent via freedom of information requests showed that 37 councils spent more than £31m on one-off cash payments to private landlords on 10,792 occasions in 2024-25. Continue reading...

ai_summary: English councils are paying landlords incentives to house homeless families.
Data shows 37 councils spent £31 million in one-off payments.
The payments are to persuade landlords to house homeless families.
The data was gathered by Generation Rent.
Campaigners call it a "senseless waste of public money."
